intro: Sida densiuscula, commonly known as the dense-hairy sida, is a small flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open woodlands. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
